caption:
Beginner's Hypothesis, a new Problem Statement for sophomores, Live Now! Not your classic Kaggle challenge, a newer approach, a challenge for everyone! Give your shot, every attempt counts!

Check the link in bio(Beginner's Hypothesis) for the Challenge!

Beginner’s hypothesis is now live for freshers along with a small tease of the problem statement for sophomores. Leaderboard position holders will go straight to interviews to be a part of DSG. Good luck!

Blog-a-thon is now LIVE. Gear up to write some of the most fascinating blogs. Submit your blogs latest by 20th March.
Check the link in bio for guidelines!

DSG Recruitments for this session are now LIVE. Missed your shot at BYOP? Don't worry, we got you covered:

1. BYOP- Making end-to-end projects gives you the high, seeing your ideas come to action? Give your all in this month-long code sprint to complete your project, while we are there to pull you out if you get stuck.

2. Beginner's Hypothesis - Kaggle contests seem fun? Make your best submission for the challenge that goes live on 13th March, with different problem Statements for 1y and 2y, and climb your way to the leaderboard. Get your skills sharpened till then, explore through Kaggle and DSG-provided resources.

3. Blog-a-thon: Got conceptual clarity like no one else? If you feel you can intuitively understand algorithms and concepts and can make them explainable to others as well, publish those thoughts in your head and make your thinking astonish us!

Well, we are no professors that can teach you Data Science 0 to 100. So, it only makes it fair if people don't have to go through a test to get in either. There will be NO pen-and-paper test for recruitments, so now only your own efforts can make you come around here. All the best junta, get ready for a time of learning and fun!

Congratulations to the selected candidates!
The selected candidates will be added to a discord server. They are expected to start learning and working towards their mid evaluation goal and asking doubts on discord till they come to campus.
Even if you are not selected, please feel free to continue working on your project and ask doubts on our discord. We and the data science community collectively can help each other out there.
Don't forget to keep looking out for our upcoming events!

Deadline Extended!
Catering to the multiple requests recieved, we give you one more day to enhance your proposal.
The new deadline for BYOP proposal submission is now 21st February!

Inviting all the first and second years to join us for a month of machine learning madness! So folks, start brainstorming about a project idea, and submit your proposal in the mentioned format(scan the QR code) latest by 20th February! Top performers will get direct interviews for recruitments in DSG.
Link in bio!

Hey folks!
Interested in becoming a part of the machine learning revolution? DSG is organizing a recruitment talk for both first and second yearites to make you aware of our recruitment procedures. Join us, and get a chance to become a part of DSG and expand your skills in the rapidly growing field.
For those not in campus, we'll also be streaming the talk on our youtube channel - https://www.youtube.com/@dsgiitr

Attention all Machine Learning enthusiasts! Expand your skills with scikit-learn, one of the most widely used Python library for machine learning. Join us for a comprehensive workshop that covers Regression, Classification and get introduced to a solid foundation for using scikit-learn in your projects.
Join us with your Laptops fully charged!
Link in bio!

Join our Python Workshop on Wednesday! Learn Python basics, Object-Oriented Programming, and popular libraries like Numpy, Matplotlib, and Pandas. Bring your laptops and let's make a head start in data science together!

Get ready to dive in the world of Compilers, Machine Learning and Open source developement. Our guest, Gagandeep Singh is a seasoned compiler developer and passionate open source contributor. Understanding compilers is essential to get the full picture of how your programs run under the hood and the integration of ML to this task is a new and upcoming field. DSG invites all IITR students, especially freshers and people interested in becoming a better programmer to attend this talk. We'll also discuss about open-source programs like GSoC, Outreachy. Do Join!

We're proud to announce Cisco as the official Title Sponsor of Convolve.

#convolve #cisco #caciitg #ai #ml #hackathon #iitg #iitb #iitm #iitr #iitd #iitbhu

Ever watched AI agents just straight-up demolish the games that you all love by beating expert-level human players? Or a robot flexing by solving Rubik's cube singlehandedly?

Ever wondered about the underlying theories and ideas behind these creations? Ever wanted to learn to create such AI? Now is your chance.

DSG presents,
Open Discussions on Reinforcement Learning.
We plan to organize weekly Open discussions, where we discuss various ideas and algorithms that serve as the foundation of RL. We invite you all to participate in the discussions actively.

Timeline and Resources- link in bio
Just take a look at the doc; it contains links to some RL applications mentioned above.

Hope to see you at the First discussion:
11th December, Sunday 6 pm
DSG's Discord Server (link in bio)

#datascience #machinelearning #deeplearning #reinforcementlearning #iit #iitroorkee #rl #dataanalytics #computervision #nlp #pytorch #statistics #datamining #coding #ml #dl

"I am telling you, the world's first trillionaires are going to come from somebody who masters AI and all its derivatives and applies it in ways we never thought of." ~Mark Cuban

Greetings from DSG, IITR!

For the first time, 6 IITs and @cisco have come together to organize CONVOLVE, an ML/AI Hackathon, which is unlike anything that has ever been conducted before. The competition is open to students across the globe! So, if you are a Data Science enthusiast and often wonder how you fare against the sharpest minds, then this is the chance to test your mettle!

The competition aims to spotlight some of the finest practitioners of Data Science and put them against each other. The participants are expected to be well-versed in Machine Learning and Data Analytics methods and how real-life Industry problems are solved using them. The competition is open to all and consists of 3 rounds. The final round will be hosted offline at IIT Guwahati.

Registration for participants closes on 10th December.

Check out the link for registration in the poster and bio!

#convolve #createdbyiits #presentedbycisco #cisco #dsgiitr #ai #ml #hackathon #machinelearning #ideas #hack #code #prizes #competition #registrationsopen #iit #iitg #iitb #iitm #iitr #iitd #iitbhu #iits #workshop

Unless you’ve been really off-grid (thanks JEE), you’ve most definitely heard about how AI is already altering the world, flooding your imagination with mental images of malicious cyborgs or of self-driven cars and voice-controlled digital assistants. While these are incredible in their own right, they just scratch the surface of Data Science.

‘If everyone can code; then everyone can build AI with the right set of tools and an intuitive understanding of probability and statistics.’

We, at DSG are a team of data science enthusiasts trying to navigate our way through this ever-transforming territory, while constantly working to make this field a little less overwhelming for the campus junta and a tad more enjoyable.

So join us in the Intro Talk this 24th, where we tell you a bit more about this journey of ours and can answer all your queries and show you the path of moving ahead in the field.

Date: 24th November 2022
Time: 6:45 PM
Venue: New LHC 103
Excited to see you there!
Team DSG.

(PS- We had DALL-E (an AI algorithm https://openai.com/blog/dall-e/) make the cute robot in the poster for us!
Prompt- “a painting of a confused robot trying to do math.“)

Hello People of IITR! DSG is coming up with a Practical Deep Learning Sprint Series, wherein we'll be conducting sprints in which students will be coding along with us basic implementation of various Deep Learning concepts. An assignment for each sprint, along with resources will be shared at the beginning of the sprint. Students can try to work their way through it on their own, although if anyone is stuck somewhere, we'll be helping them out during the sprint.

In the first sprint, we'll be learning a basic implementation of Artificial Neural Networks. Check out the resources shared (link in bio) and register for the event!

Date: 1st Nov
Time: 6 pm
Venue: New LHC-002
Resources: Link in Bio

DSG will be conducting an Open Research Paper Discussion on Introduction to AI Security. The Discussion would not just remain restricted to the contents of the research paper, but also would start upon from the basic understanding of the domain of AI Security. However, it is highly recommended to have a look at the resources provided before showing up for the discussion.

Date: 24/08 Wednesday
Time: 9 pm
Location: SDS room, SAC
Resources: Scan QR code or check Linktree in bio!

Continuing this session's series of Paper Discussions, DSG is hosting an open discussion on NeuS: Learning Neural Implicit Surfaces by Volume Rendering for Multi-view Reconstruction (link in bio)

Imagine taking just a few pictures of an object and getting its full 3-D model! Well, we are about to learn that only!

In NeuS, we propose to represent a surface as the zero-level set of a signed distance function (SDF) and develop a new volume rendering method to train a neural SDF representation. We observe that the conventional volume rendering method causes inherent geometric errors (i.e. bias) for surface reconstruction, and therefore propose a new formulation that is free of bias in the first order of approximation, thus leading to more accurate surface reconstruction even without the mask supervision. Experiments on the DTU dataset and the BlendedMVS dataset show that NeuS outperforms the state-of-the-arts in high-quality surface reconstruction, especially for objects and scenes with complex structures and self-occlusion.

Date: 15th July
Time: 10:00 pm
Platform: DSG Discord Server

Data Science Group welcomes all the new recruits!!

It was a very tough choice to select a few candidates from the pool of enthusiastic and talented freshers and sophomores who turned up.

For those who couldn't make the cut, fret not, you can always reach out to us on Instagram, Facebook, Discord or Slack. Happy Learning :)

Continuing this session's series of Paper Discussions, DSG is hosting an open discussion on Privacy and Utility Preserving Sensor-Data Transformations (link in bio)

Sensitive inferences and user re-identification are major threats to privacy when raw sensor data from wearable or portable devices are shared with cloud-assisted applications, so this research paper gives us a way to prevent privacy loss by using replacement autoencoder and anonymizing autoencoder, by tuning privacy- utility trade off.A basic understanding of transformations, statistics will be more than enough.

Date: 2nd June
Time: 10:00pm
Platform: DSG Discord server

Hello people of IITR! We at Data Science Group are looking for designers to take charge of the interface design aspect of our ongoing development projects while also lending their creative minds to design the graphics representing the group and its activities.

Interested candidates may apply through the form[link in bio] before 29th May (Sunday) 11:59pm.

We will be contacting you soon after and give you a problem statement to work on, based on which, you might get an opportunity to become a part of our family and work with us.

Feel free to contact us for any queries on the contact or through our Discord server

The second installment in this session's Research Paper Discussion Series is here, where DSG will be hosting an open discussion on Long-Tail Learning via Logit Adjustment. (Link to paper in bio)

This paper talks about a simple method to train models in long-tailed setting, in which the training dataset is heavily biased towards a few dominant classes, and only has a small number of samples to train on for the other classes. The only prerequisites to understand this paper are familiarity with basic probability terms and the mathematical formulation of the cross entropy loss function.

Date: 21st May
Time: 10 pm
Platform: DSG Discord server

Starting with this session's series of Paper Discussions, DSG is hosting an open discussion on Efficiently Identifying Task Groupings for Multi-Task Learning (link to paper in bio)

This paper presents a prominent work in the field of multi-task learning which itself is one of the rising fields among the various areas in the machine learning landscape. We would be delving into this paper from the ground-up and only a basic understanding of gradient descent and backpropagation would be suffice to join in with us!

Date: 14th May
Time: 10:30pm
Platform: DSG Discord server

Data Science Group welcomes all the new recruits!!

It was a very tough choice to select a few candidates from the pool of enthusiastic and talented freshers and sophomores who turned up.

For those who couldn't make the cut, fret not, you can always reach out to us on Instagram, Facebook, Discord or Slack. Happy Learning :)

Hi everyone, we are finally on instagram!

DSG is a student organization in IIT Roorkee. We aim to work on innovative open source projects in the domain of Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Reinforcement Learning, bridging the gap between research and industry.

Follow us to stay updated about our events and learn data science.
